result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles J Leroy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles J Leroy

defendant.name: Leroy, Charles J
defendant.address: N4805 State St, Pine River, WI 54965

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:57 am case called. Defendant Charles J Leroy in court with attorney Chadwick James Kaehne.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on record by ADA.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 75 days WCJ, STAYED and places the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time credit. Credit for 2 days served. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through,    The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD:  Attorney Amaro Lopez in Court for Chadwick James Kaehne in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. P/S scheduled as requested.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 11:45 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Chadwick James Kaehne in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kaehne requests additional status. Discovery is being exchanged.  Status conference scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called at 1:10 PM: Defendant Charles J Leroy in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Defendant Charles J Leroy in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD:  Custody status will depend on eligibility.  DA argues as to bond - PO Hold confirmed.  In light of hold, argues for $1000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  SPD has no position on bond today.   ARGN to proceed.  NGP received and entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 03:20 pm.
